results.title: Children of Germany: in the Rhineland
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Four boys are shown on a day’s excursion in the Rhineland. As they sail with a pilot of a barge from Kaub to St Goar, navigation and the Rhine’s industrial importance are explained. The boys climb the Spitzenstein and see vineyards, potato patches, castles and historical villages of the Rhine.

results.title: Children of China
results.brief_description: In this film, the home and community customs, the school training, and the family relationships which concern children in a remote and primitive Chinese village before World War 2, are studied.

results.title: The Children of Bet Alpha
results.creator_credit: Krosney, Phoenix Films and Ritzau Film
results.brief_description: An intensive look at Israel’s communal approach to raising children, shot at Kibbutz Bet Alpha. Looks at four age groups within Bet Alpha - infants, three year olds, seven year olds and twelve year olds. The camera records the children’s behaviour and the film describes in detail Bet Alpha’s approach to collective education which in many ways preceded other modern approaches to education.

results.title: Children learning by experience
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson, John Taylor and Realist Films
results.brief_description: This is a study of children as they go about absorbed in their own affairs, learning in their own way. As children grow, they learn both by experience and by imitation; parents and teachers have to decide when it is better to interfere and when it is better to let children find out for themselves in their own way. This film presents a number of situations in which children and their learning processes raise problems which parents and teachers encounter from day to day, and suggestions are made as to how these problems can be solved. This is one of a series of films which includes “Your children and you”, “Your children’s sleep”, “Your children’s meals” and “Children growing up with other people”.

results.title: Children learn from filmstrips
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Frank Spiller, Richard Gilbert and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Illustrates the value of audio-visual instruction in primary schools. Children learn naturally about a subject such as the owl through visual presentation. Filmstrips help bring the world into the class-room. Various techniques for their use are suggested; silent run through for review, or a few frames at a time can be shown followed by discussion. Exercises, compositions and projects can be set afterwards to help reinforce what the children have learned.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Jackson, Frank Spiller, Richard Gilbert and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: N.Y., N.Y.: a day in New York
results.brief_description: A portrait of the city from the predawn mists of the East River to the nighttime jazz of Broadway, a series of unique images is created from the familiar streets and sights of effects as floating buildings, horns that seem to undulate to the rhythm of their music, and cars and buses that stretch and weave. A kind of multiplication theme dominates in the film and shots rhythmically flow and change in a dance-like structure. Thompson says he “wanted to make fun of the ridiculousness of the life of a New Yorker.” He did, but his film goes further and describes the city’s diversity and its beauty as well. Music by Gene Forrell.

results.title: Children in town
results.creator_credit: Centralfilm, Radio Sweden and Stockholm Parks Department
results.brief_description: Stockholm, a city of nearly a million inhabitants has made considerable progress in dealing with the problem of playgrounds for children living in urban areas. Over 160 large playgrounds, most of which have facilities for both indoor and outdoor games, have been provided.

results.title: Children in the hospital
results.creator_credit: Edward Mason, M D and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Describes through the experience of two young girls, the methods used in the pediatrics department of Boston City Hospital to alleviate the psychological burden of hospitalisation. Shows the varied reaction of the children and demonstrates the importance of adult assistance in reducing the pain and the disturbing consequences of hospitalisation.

results.title: Children crossing
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The patrol officer system in Tasmanian schools and its success in avoiding road accidents to children. Volunteers are trained by Road Safety Officers in supervising children at dangerous road crossings, on school buses and public transport. The status of school patrol officers and the extent of their authority.
